#Text=Deoghar
#Text=Deoghar ( also called Baidyanath Dham ) is in Jharkhand .
#Text=It is famous for the Baidyanath ( Shiva ) temple .
#Text=Get in
#Text=By rail - the nearest railway station is Baidyanath Dham ( Deoghar ) which is a terminal station of a 7+km branch line originating at Jasidih Jn . on the Howrah-Delhi main line .
#Text=Apart from local trains on the branch line trekkers ( type of jeep ) taking in passengers on a per person fare basis and auto rickshaws are available .
#Text=Auto-Rickshaws are available frequently just outside the Jasidih railway station .
#Text=They charge ₹8 per person in a shared auto and up to ₹60 in a Reserved auto .
#Text=However , due to the road bridge that connects Jasidih to Deoghar collapsing , the auto rickshaws take alternative longer route thus charge about ₹15 per person and up to ₹100 in reserved .
#Text=The best means to get to Deoghar is the local up-down train available every few hours at Jasidih Railway station on Platform No. 4
#Text=By road - Deoghar is approachable from Kolkata 373 km , Giridih 60 km , Patna 281 km , Dumka 67 km , Madhupur 30 km , Ranchi 250 km
#Text=Shimultala 53 km and other places .
#Text=Regular buses are available from surrounding towns .
#Text=No need to wait for minutes or hours , all conveyance are available in this route .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Unmetered taxis or hired cars , auto rickshaws , tongas and cycle rickshaws are available .
#Text=Tongas charge around ₹400 , autorickshaws around ₹500 and hired cars ₹700-₹1,000 for a visit to most of the important places in the town .
#Text=See

#Text=Baidyanath Temple - According to Hindu mythology , Ravana went to Mount Kailash and prayed to Lord Shiva , who gave him a Jyotirlinga to take to his land , with the promise not to place the lingam anywhere else .
#Text=In case that happened , the lingam would remain fixed on that spot forever .
#Text=The gods , who were unhappy at the prospect of the divine lingam being established in the enemy kingdom , which would render them powerless against their adversary , worked a trick on Ravana .
#Text=He mistakenly handed over the lingam to a Brahmin , who grounded it at Deoghar .
#Text=Ravana did his best to uproot it but beyond breaking the tip he was unsuccessful .
#Text=In deep remorse , he used to come to this place everyday and worship the lingam by offering water from the Ganges .
#Text=Historically the temple is dated to 1596 .
#Text=The temple has almost all god & goddesses and whole temple is built on a single rock .
#Text=During the month of ' Sawan ' people from across the country come to offer ganga jal to the divine Shiva ling .
#Text=Balanand Ashram Yogashala , Karnibagh - Yoga Institution .
#Text=Fuljhari Pahar
#Text=- 48 km from Deoghar , this is hill for those who want to start mountain climbing .
#Text=It has a height of around 800 meters and it is safe for climbing .
#Text=Harila Joria - 8 km from Deoghar , famous for Shiva Temple
#Text=Nandan Pahar - A picnic spot with some basic rides atop a small hill .
#Text=Vehicles come to the base but one has to walk up .
#Text=Naulakha Mandir - it is a beautiful temple of Radha-Krishna on the outskirts of Deogarh
#Text=Prabhu Jagadbandhu Ashrama - 4 km from Deoghar , on the way to Tapovan , near Charki Pahari crossing - for short stay in a cool , pristine environment with monks and other ashramiks .
#Text=Ramkrishna Mission Vidyapith , Tiwari Chowk ( Williams Town ) .
#Text=Satsang Ashram - it is a holy place for the followers of Sri Sri Thakur Anukulachandra .
#Text=It also has a museum and a zoo with a sarva dharma mandir .
#Text=Tapovan - A picnic spot with some caves and lots of monkeys .
#Text=8 km from Deoghar , Balanand Brahmachari used to meditate here .
#Text=Trikut - 16 km from Deoghar , source of the River Mayurakshi - vehicles come to the base but one has to walk up .
#Text=Recently a ropeway has been built to ferry people to the top .
#Text=Do
#Text=Rikhia Ashram , Village Pania Pagaar , ☏ +916432290870 , +91 9304488889 , +91 9430799449 ( also fax ) .
#Text=Rikhia peeth is the tapobhumi ( place of spiritual sadhana or practice ) of Swami Satyananda Saraswati , founder of the Bihar School of Yoga , Munger .
#Text=Swami Satyananda came to Rikhia with the sankalpa to live in seclusion , on 23 September 1989 .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Beautiful Bangles ( laah ki churri ) , mandit line ( way to mandir ) .
#Text=Beautiful bangles shop are available , on temple lane .
#Text=Bihar State Handloom Emporium
#Text=Santhal Parganas Gramodyog Samittee
#Text=Santhal Parganas Khadi Gramodyog Bhavan
#Text=Eat
#Text=One normally has food in the place of stay but there are numerous small eateries .
#Text=Deoghar has some food specialities :
#Text=Bel ka Morabba
#Text=Another speciality of Deoghar available form September to March .
#Text=One must try this .
#Text=Langra Aam - Deoghar 's another speciality is its langra aam .
#Text=One must never miss it .

#Text=Paratha - made of flour filled with sattu and potato and blended with pure deshi ghee , famous location ' Parathas of Luchhu Shah ' in the mandir lane , any one can point you to the shop when asked for .
#Text=Peda - a type of milk-based sweet-meat is the Deoghar speciality .
#Text=A visitor to Deoghar must not miss it .
#Text=Rabri - made of condensed milk , available throughout the year .
#Text=Tilkut - made of til and sugar mixed and crushed together , mostly available from the month of December to February .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Most of the places of Deoghar have groundwater as their main water source and therefore it is suggested to carry a bottle of mineral water in your journey .
#Text=Lassi ( dahhi ki lassi ) , on the mandir lane .
#Text=Try cool dahhi ki lassi , it is also famous in Deoghar .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Hotel Anand , Telephone +91 6432 220540 , Rooms ₹200-₹350 .
#Text=Hotel Bharti , Very close to temple .
#Text=Telephone 06432-223022 , Rooms ₹200-₹400 .
#Text=Hotel Samrat , Telephone +91 6432 222402 , Rooms ₹250-₹400 .
#Text=Hotel Yasoda International , Telephone +91kol .
#Text=Hotel Yatrik , Telephone +91 6432 323 299 , Rooms ₹300-₹400 .
#Text=Joty .
#Text=Near to the West enrance gate of Baidyanath Temple 350 .
#Text=Nataraj Vihar ( Jharkhand Tourism ) , Telephone +91 6432 222422 , Rooms ₹200-₹500 .
#Text=New Grand Hotel , Telephone +91 6432 225245 , Rooms ₹250-₹350
#Text=Hotel Prova , Telephone +91 6432 224112 , Rooms ₹200-₹300 .
#Text=Saraswati Ashram , Mansarowar Road , near Mandir , ☏ +91-9234716393 .
#Text=Saraswati Ashram is one of the budget hotels at Deoghar very near Bhaidyanath Dham Mandir , Good place to stay and good place to eat . ₹200-500.
#Text=Sewa Dham ( Nandan Pahar ) , opposite Nandan Pahar Baidyanathdham ( 2 km from Satsangnagar Chowk ) , ☏ +917903148155 , +91 9204255482 , ✉ mishrasanjeev68@rediffmail.com .
#Text=Ashram-type accommodation , run by a trust , with non-AC rooms , big halls , one kitchen providing Vegan food , groups may use the kitchen upon request .
